raw: U.S. crude, gasoline stockpiles surge, fuel demand slumps on growing pandemic .

raw: ( Reuters ) - U.S. crude oil and gasoline inventories surged last week while demand fell sharply and refineries throttled back activity in response to a sharp falloff in fuel demand due to the coronavirus pandemic .

raw: Nick Oxford Crude inventories rose by 13.8 million barrels in the week to March 27 to 469.2 million barrels , the U.S. Energy Information Administration said Wednesday .
replaced: Nick Oxford Crude inventories That by 13.8 million barrels in the week to March 27 to 469.2 million barrels , EIA  the EIA report Wednesday .

raw: That was the biggest one - week rise since 2016 , and analysts expect stocks to keep rising as refineries curb output and gasoline demand falls .
replaced: That was the biggest one - week rise since 2016 , and analysts expect stocks to keep rising as refineries curb output and gasoline demand falls .

raw: State governments have issued orders trying to halt the spread of the virus , and many residents are staying out of cars .
replaced: State governments have issued orders trying to halt the spread of growing pandemic , and many residents are staying out of cars .

raw: Gasoline demand fell by the most ever in one week , with products supplied , a proxy for demand , dropping by 2.2 million barrels per day to 6.7 million bpd .

raw: That augurs for more refining cutbacks down the road .

raw: “ Demand is a disaster , ” said Bob Yawger , director of energy futures at Mizuho in New York .

raw: “ We have a ways to go before these numbers bottom out - this is going to be the way the next few reports are and it will drag on this way for quite some time . ”
